info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 8 at 10:18AM CDT until May 10 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Morris, Franklin and Titus Counties.
For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White Oak Creek near Talco.
* WHEN...Until Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of creek bottoms. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the creek bottoms should move them to higher ground.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CDT Thursday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1030 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Franklin, TX; Morris, TX; Titus, TX
